name.namePart: Lindquist, G. E. E. (Gustavus Elmer Emanuel), 1886-1967

titleInfo.title: Two Men in Uniform in front of Bank Building, Camp Function

mods.abstract: Recto annotation: "Camp Function" (WT) - Sign: *BANK* Checks Cashed & Deposits Secured [illegible]. General Banking Business Transacted. This banking service and temporary bank building is erected by the Central National Bank of Junction City who will commence at once on this site the erection of a large modern bank building.

Verso annotation: Dear Mr. Lindquist: Just happened along when a picture of the bank was taken. The other fellow is a KU man and pal of mine. Getting rather chilly now. Hope you have a full house now and are going along fine. Regards to Mrs. L and the boys, Wm. [Ober[?]ing]. Elmer E. Lindquist, Roe Institute, Wichita Kans. Postmark: Junction City, KANS. OCT 15, 5:30 PM, 1917 [U.S. POSTAGE – 1 CENT]

titleInfo.title: Folder title: Indians & World War I

location.physicalLocation: The Burke Library (Columbia University Libraries) at Union Theological Seminary in the City of New York
